author: Hadeel Hashem
title: Biodynamic Farming: A Sustainable Solution for Climate Change
text:
In the heart of Omaha, a revolution quietly unfolds on the fertile grounds of Benson Bounty. Here, Mark Brannen and his wife Michelle have turned their small farm into a beacon of sustainability and productivity by embracing biodynamic farming principles. Their journey, inspired by Rudolf Steiner's profound knowledge of agriculture, demonstrates a harmonious blend of natural science, agronomic expertise, human wisdom, and spiritual scientific insight. This unique approach not only nurtures the land but also offers a blueprint for combating climate change through innovative agricultural practices.
The Genesis of Biodynamic Farming
At the core of Benson Bounty's philosophy lies Rudolf Steiner's Agriculture Course, a seminal work that has reshaped modern farming. Steiner, a visionary in his own right, brought forth a method of agriculture that transcends traditional practices by integrating cosmic dimensions into soil science. His exhaustive study of scientific subjects, coupled with personal experiences and a deep dive into specialist agricultural literature, laid the foundation for a farming approach that respects and utilizes the intricate relationships between the earth, plants, animals, and the cosmos. Steiner's agricultural method is not just about growing food; it's about nurturing the earth and, by extension, humanity itself.
Practicing What Steiner Preached
Since 2015, Mark and Michelle Brannen have been steadfast in their commitment to biodynamic farming, a testament to their dedication to Steiner's vision. By rotating crops, planting cover crops, making homemade compost, and limiting outside inputs, they have created a sustainable system that views the farm as a whole entity. This holistic approach eliminates the need for chemical fertilizers and pesticides, relying instead on the natural relationships that exist within the farm ecosystem. The Demeter Biodynamic Farm Standard, which the Brannens adhere to, underscores this philosophy by requiring whole farm certification, dedicating at least 10% of land as a wildlife reserve, and the use of biodynamic preparations to enhance soil health and fertility.
Reaping the Benefits of Biodynamic Farming
The results of the Brannens' labor are nothing short of remarkable. Biodynamic practices have not only improved the soil health of Benson Bounty but have also led to increased yields. This success allows them to supply fresh, nutritious produce to local markets and restaurants, fostering a strong connection between the farm and the surrounding community. Moreover, by reducing energy use and greenhouse gas emissions, biodynamic farming stands as a potent tool in the fight against climate change. It offers a glimpse into a future where agriculture works in harmony with nature, rather than against it, to provide for the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own.
In the end, the story of Benson Bounty is more than just a tale of agricultural success. It's a narrative that weaves together Rudolf Steiner's visionary ideas with the practical achievements of a small farm in Omaha. It highlights the potential of biodynamic farming to transform our relationship with the land, fostering a more sustainable and productive agricultural system. As we look to the future, the principles practiced by the Brannens offer valuable lessons in how we might navigate the challenges of climate change, food security, and environmental sustainability. It's a testament to the power of combining scientific knowledge with spiritual wisdom to create a world where both the earth and its inhabitants can thrive.

author: tajuina
title: China ocultó hundimiento de su submarino de propulsión nuclear más avanzado, según EEUU
text:
Un submarino del Ejército de China se desplaza en las aguas del mar amarillo Chinamil.com.cn China intentó ocultar el hundimiento de su submarino de propulsión nuclear más reciente, afirmó este jueves un funcionario de defensa estadounidense.
El Wall Street Journal informó del hundimiento, ocurrido en un astillero a principios de este año, y compartió imágenes de satélite en las que se ven grandes grúas recuperando el submarino.
“No es sorprendente que la Armada china haya intentado ocultar el hecho de que su nuevo submarino de ataque de propulsión nuclear, el primero de este tipo, se hundió en el muelle”, dijo el funcionario, que pidió mantener el anonimato.
“Además de las preguntas obvias sobre los estándares de fabricación (…) el incidente plantea otras preguntas más importantes sobre la responsabilidad interna de la armada china y la supervisión de la industria de defensa de China, que desde hace mucho tiempo está plagada de corrupción”, añadió.
El hundimiento supone un revés para China, que busca modernizar su flota, la mayor del mundo.
Estados Unidos y Reino Unido proporcionarán a Australia submarinos de propulsión nuclear para ampliar el número de países con estas naves.
Un acuerdo criticado por Pekín, que lo considera una respuesta estratégica a las ambiciones militares chinas en Asia-Pacífico. AFP

author: Casa Editorial El Tiempo
title: El doblete de Leonardo Campana no fue suficiente y New England Revolution cayó ante New York Red Bulls por un gol agónico | Otras Ligas de Fútbol | Futbolred
text:
Este miércoles, NE Revolution fue derrotado 3 a 5 por NY Red Bulls a pesar de que el delantero Leonardo Campana marcó en 2 oportunidades. Los goles del partido para el local los anotaron Daniel Edelman (10' 2T), Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting (24' 2T y 37' 2T) y Emil Forsberg (26' 2T y 42' 2T, de penal). Mientras que los goles de visitante los hizo Leonardo Campana (4' 1T y 47' 2T) y Kyle Duncan (29' 1T, en contra).
Luca Langoni tuvo la oportunidad de aumentar la diferencia, pero el palo le negó el grito de gol a los 29 minutos de la primera etapa.
El desempeño Emil Forsberg lo posicionó como el jugador más destacado del encuentro. El volante de New York Red Bulls metió 2 goles y buscó el arco contrario con 6 disparos.
Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting fue otro de los jugadores destacados. El delantero de New York Red Bulls mostró su mejor nivel al marcar 2 goles y rematar 4 veces al arco contrario.
El estratega de NY Red Bulls, Sandro Schwarz, paró al once inicial con una formación 4-5-1 con Carlos Coronel en el arco; Kyle Duncan, Sean Nealis, Noah Eile y Omar Valencia en la línea defensiva; Daniel Edelman, Ronald Donkor, Mohammed Sofo, Emil Forsberg y Wikelman Carmona en el medio; y Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting en el ataque.
Por su parte, los elegidos por Caleb Porter salieron al campo de juego con un esquema 4-5-1 con Aljaz Ivacic bajo los tres palos; Brandon Bye, Brayan Ceballos, Keegan Hughes y Tanner Beason en defensa; Matt Polster, Alhassan Yusuf, Luca Langoni, Carles Gil y Peyton Miller en la mitad de cancha; y Leonardo Campana en la delantera.
Sergii Boiko fue designado como el árbitro principal del encuentro en el Sports Illustrated Stadium.
En la siguiente jornada NY Red Bulls se enfrentará de local ante Inter Miami y NE Revolution disputará el juego de local frente a Orlando City SC.
Cambios en New York Red Bulls- 61' 2T - Salieron Daniel Edelman por Wiktor Bogacz, Kyle Duncan por Alexander Hack y Wikelman Carmona por Julian Hall
- 70' 2T - Salieron Mohammed Sofo por Dennis Gjengaar y Omar Valencia por Raheem Edwards
- 8' 2T Wikelman Carmona (Conducta antideportiva) y 30' 2T Noah Eile (Conducta antideportiva)
- 45' 2T - Salió Peyton Miller por Will Sands
- 65' 2T - Salió Brayan Ceballos por Wyatt Omsberg
- 72' 2T - Salió Luca Langoni por Tomás Chancalay
- 73' 2T - Salió Brandon Bye por Ilay Feingold
- 79' 2T - Salió Tanner Beason por Luis Díaz
- 48' 1T Leonardo Campana (Conducta antideportiva), 15' 2T Brayan Ceballos (Conducta antideportiva), 41' 2T Keegan Hughes (Conducta antideportiva) y 50' 2T Luis Díaz (Conducta antideportiva)

author: Closer
title: Les oiseaux de la Seine à Paris: une étonnante biodiversité
text:
RFI Les oiseaux de la Seine à Paris: une étonnante biodiversité Lire l'article complet Olivier Favier 16 février 2024 à 11:06 AM
L’Île de France concentre 20 % de la population de la France sur 2 % de son territoire. Paris est la septième ville la plus densément peuplée au monde. En-dehors des espèces les plus communes, la biodiversité se concentre dans les parcs, les cimetières et les bois adjacents. Mais ce glacis est aussi traversée par la Seine, qui fait exception. Elle affiche même une dynamique croissante, du moins en ce qui concerne les oiseaux.
En 2018, un couple de martins-pêcheurs avait niché près de la Tour Eiffel . Si cet oiseau ne nage pas, il se nourrit bien évidemment de poissons, qu’il assomme et avale ensuite tête première. Le fleuve n’est pas son espace favori – il préfère les points d’eau et le canaux – et son vol est extrêmement rapide - il peut atteindre les 80 km/h. Autant vous le dire d’emblée, vos chances d’en apercevoir un à Paris sont à peu près nulles.
Bien plus imposant, le grand cormoran mesure 90 cm pour une envergure d’1,50 mètre. Lui aussi se nourrit de poissons et compose de vastes dortoirs de plusieurs centaines d’individus dans le Grand Paris – à l’Île-Saint-Denis, par exemple, ou à Champigny-sur-Marne. Le jour, les oiseaux se dispersent partout sur la Seine : vous en verrez autour du Pont Royal ou près de la gare d’Austerlitz, en hiver cependant. À la belle saison, il part se reproduire en Allemagne du Nord, au Pays-Bas, au Danemark.
De plus en plus d’oiseaux nicheurs

author: Mark Zeigler - The San Diego Union-Tribune (TNS)
title: Mark Zeigler: An ailing Olympic movement turns to Paris for salvation

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Tyres of Pak’s terror now punctured: PM
text:
‘Art 370 abrogation biggest tribute to Patel’
*Hands which held bombs now begging
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, May 2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today dubbed the Congress party a “disciple” of Pakistan, and targeted Rahul Gandhi saying the neighbouring country was eager to make the ‘shehzada’ of the grand old party India’s next Prime Minister as the country’s enemies want a weak Government to be at the helm.
Addressing mega election rallies in Anand and Jamnagar in Gujarat, he said that Congress wants to change India’s Constitution to provide reservation of Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and Other Backward Classes (OBC) communities to Muslims.
Modi’s comments linking Congress with Pakistan came a day after Chaudhry Fawad Hussain, a former Minister in Imran Khan’s Cabinet in Pakistan, reportedly shared a video featuring Rahul Gandhi on his social media handle and praised him.
“Pakistan is crying because Congress is dying here. You all must have learnt that Pakistani leaders are now praying for Congress. Pakistan is eager to make ‘shehzada’ (referring to Rahul Gandhi) the next PM. This is not surprising because we already know that Congress is Pakistan’s ‘murid’ (follower)” he said.
“The partnership between Pakistan and Congress has now been exposed completely. It shows that the country’s enemies want a weak Government in India, not a strong one…A weak Government which was there at the time of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack. They want a corrupt Government which was there before 2014. But Modi’s strong Government neither bows down nor does it stop,” the PM added.
Follow the Daily Excelsior channel on WhatsApp
Unlike in the past when Congress was in power, the “tyres of Pakistan’s terror have got punctured” now, he said. “A country which used to export terror in the past, is now struggling to import ‘atta’ (flour). The hands which used to hold bombs are now holding ‘bheekh ka katora’ (begging bowl),” he said.
The then Prime Minster served as the guest of Kashmiri separatists and Congress leaders came forward to save Ajmal Kasab, the lone gunman arrested after the 26/11 terror attack on Mumbai, Modi said.
“Books were written to save jihadis of the Mumbai terror attack and a Congress leader released (one such) book. In Delhi, when terrorists were killed at Batla House, the ‘madam’ of the Congress could not stop tears. When Afzal Guru was sentenced to hang, people from this ecosystem reached the Supreme Court and the President,” the PM said.
These people are now calling for “vote jihad” (religion based voting to stop the BJP), he said.
On the occasion, Modi remembered Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and said the abrogation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir was his biggest tribute to the country’s first Home Minister.
People across the world are now saying that India is a global bright spot. India is seen as ‘vishwa bandhu’ (global friend) who can resolve conflicts between two countries, Modi said.
On the issue of quota, he said, “Congress wants to give reservation to Muslims, the party’s favourite vote bank. For that, they want to change the Constitution. I challenge Congress to give in writing that they will not change the Constitution to give reservation to Muslims on religious basis.”

author: Sandra Loise
title: Piura: vecinos del asentamiento humano “La Primavera” en riesgo de inundación por falta de obras de prevención | RPP Noticias
text: El asentamiento humano 'La Primavera' ha sido considerado una zona vulnerable ante posibles lluvias por el [Fenómeno El Niño](https://rpp.pe/noticias/fenomeno-el-nino?ref=rpp), por lo que piden ayuda al Gobierno Central y al [Gobierno Regional del Piura](https://rpp.pe/noticias/piura?ref=rpp). Los vecinos del asentamiento humano “La Primavera”, en el distrito de Castilla, en la región [Piura](https://rpp.pe/noticias/piura?ref=rpp), denunciaron que se encuentran en riesgo de inundación ante posibles [lluvias](https://rpp.pe/noticias/lluvias) por falta de obras de prevención en esta zona. El asentamiento humano “La Primavera” ha sido considerado una zona vulnerable ante posibles desastres naturales, debido a que en el año 2023 se inundó el colegio Manuel Escorza. Un año después, el equipo de RPP constató que la situación sigue prácticamente igual. Los vecinos de esta zona del distrito de Castilla están preocupados por la temporada de lluvias y ante la posible llegada del [Fenómeno El Niño](https://rpp.pe/noticias/fenomeno-el-nino?ref=rpp). Verónica Terán, presidenta de Apafa del colegio Manuel Escorza, el cual se inundó en el 2023, denunció que las autoridades del gobierno Central y del [gobierno Regional de Piura](https://rpp.pe/noticias/piura?ref=rpp) no los han escuchado. Solo han contado con el apoyo de la Municipalidad de Castilla y su alcalde, Walther Guerrero Silva. “Las autoridades del gobierno central y del gobierno regional no se han manifestado. Con quien hemos contado siempre ha sido con la Municipalidad Distrital de Castilla, el alcalde siempre ha atendido nuestro llamado y de alguna manera u otra nos ha brindado su apoyo. Él es quien nos facilitó la arena para los rellenos porque el agua se empozaba de forma alarmante”, dijo la vecina a RPP. Piden obras de prevención Cabe recordar que en el año 2023 los escolares del colegio Manuel Escorza tuvieron que abandonar sus instalaciones porque se inundó el acceso principal del lugar. Las fuertes [lluvias](https://rpp.pe/noticias/lluvias) formaron una piscina y el agua llegaba a la altura de la cintura de los estudiantes. Como parte de las medidas de prevención, se habilitó otra salida ya que el acceso principal del colegio Manuel Escorza siempre se inunda. Este año, en los primeros días de enero, abrió una puerta posterior para que los escolares no se vean perjudicados. Sin embargo, esto no es suficiente. Es por ello que los vecinos del asentamiento humano “La Primavera” piden que se construyan obras de prevención al Ejecutivo y al [Gobierno de Piura](https://rpp.pe/noticias/piura?ref=rpp). Te recomendamos Comparte esta noticia

author: , York Daily Record
title: Electoral ballots damaged in Phoenix after someone set fire to a mailbox; arrest made
text: Dieter Klofkorn, 35, has been arrested for allegedly burning 20 electoral ballots inside a mailbox in Phoenix, Arizona on Thursday morning. A suspect is in custody for allegedly burning 20 electoral ballots that were inside a mailbox in Phoenix, Arizona, on Thursday morning, the city's mayor and police said. Dieter Klofkorn, 35, is accused of igniting a fire in a mailbox at a U.S. Postal Office in the area of 7th Avenue and Indian School Road around 1 a.m., Phoenix police said in a news release. The Phoenix Fire Department’s Arson Investigation Taskforce was contacted and assumed the investigation, according to police. The scene was processed, including finding nearby surveillance footage. Phoenix Fire Capt. Rob McDade confirmed to NBC News and AZFamily that 20 electoral ballots were damaged, along with additional mail. Phoenix Mayor Kate Gallego voiced her concern about this crime on X, saying: "I am concerned about the recent incident at one of our post offices involving damage to several ballots." "I am closely monitoring the situation and maintaining regular communication with the @AZSecretary , @RecordersOffice , and local and federal law enforcement," Gallego's post continued. "There is zero tolerance for criminal activity in our community, and we are working collaboratively with every level of government to bring the perpetrator to justice." Klofkorn admitted to burning ballots, said actions were not politically motivated In a follow-up X post on Thursday , Gallego announced the arrest of a suspect. "Thanks to swift action by @PhoenixPolice, @PHXFire and federal partners, we have arrested the suspect involved in this incident," the mayor's X post reads. Investigators identified Klofkorn after working on several leads, police said. He was eventually found and arrested for an outstanding and unrelated arrest warrant, according to the release. Police did not disclose what the arrest warrant was for. While in custody, Klofkorn admitted to committing the arson, police said. He went on to tell interviewing officers that he "wanted to be arrested and that his actions were not politically motivated and not related to anything involving the upcoming election," according to the department. Klofkorn was subsequently booked into jail on one felony count of arson of property. It is unclear if Klofkorn has an attorney.
